p: The obtained results are partly in line with the published studies earlier [ 2, 9, 30]. Kremer et al. [ 9] identified six phenolic compounds (rutin, quercetin, p-coumaric, ellagic, rosmarinic and syringic acids) using HPLC in methanolic and ethanolic extracts of S. montana. Amount of rosmarinic acid as a predominant compound of S. montana herb (0.21–7.84 µg/mg) depends on the used technological ways and solvents [ 30]. In ethylacetate and n-butanol extracts of S. montana the hydroxybenzoic acid derivatives (protocatechuic, syringic and vanilic acids), hydroxycinnamic acid derivatives (caffeic, p-coumaric, and ferulic acids), (±)-catechin and (–)-epicatechin were identified [ 12]. Rosmarinic acid, caffeic acid and luteolin were identified in the extracts obtained with the aid of 80% ethanol from S. montana collected in Egypt [ 2].
